pull.title: wallet: Use single FastRandomContext when creating a wallet tx
pull.body: Passing around a single randomness context shouldn't come with any downsides, but documents better where randomness is used and allows the unit test to be deterministic, if they wish to be so.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#24494](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24494) (wallet: generate random change target for each tx for better privacy by glozow)
* [#24213](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24213) (refactor: use Span in random.*; make GetRand a template, remove GetRandInt by PastaPastaPasta)
* [#24128](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24128) (wallet: BIP 326 sequence based anti-fee-snipe for taproot inputs by MarcoFalke)
* [#23475](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23475) (wallet: add config to prioritize a solution that doesn't create change in coin selection by brunoerg)
* [#23076](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23076) (Pass CFeeRate and CTxMemPool in-params by reference to const by jonatack)
* [#20640](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20640) (wallet, refactor: return out-params of CreateTransaction() as optional struct by theStack)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

comments.body: nit, any reason to be the 1st arg?
It can't be the last arg, because that requires a default value, so I picked the "least-last" arg (aka first)
